Detailed Description

Internal interface used to register OBEX servers with the Server Registry.

Warning;
This is an internal interface which must not be used outside APOXI OBEX at all.

In order to facilitate dispatching of incoming requests by TARGET header, MIME type and possibly other criteria servers must register with a central Server Registry. This registry assigns each server a system-wide unique id, the ObexServerId. Furthermore, it provides the infrastructure for mapping incoming requests onto server id's by employing a Visitor Pattern.

Concrete server implementations must implement this interface and aggregate an instance of it in order to be able to enroll themselves with the Server Registry.

See also:
ObexServerMngr

ObexServerVisitor

Member Function Documentation

virtual BOOLEAN ObexServerInfo::Accept (  ObexServerVisitor &  v  )  [pure virtual]
 

Enables usage of the visitor pattern on derived classes.

This method must be implemented by each concrete derived class to call the related Visit...() method exposed by ObexServerVisitor. The visitor pattern concept is used to scan the server registry for a server which matches certain properties. When Accept() returns 'FALSE', scanning is terminated. The result and possible parameters must be stored within the concrete visitor instance.

Parameters:
v ObexServerVisitor instance.
Returns:
'FALSE' to terminate iterating over instances, 'TRUE' otherwise.
